TopicDetails.title: CONS-CPC-JA-2019
TopicDetails.callTitle: Financial contributions for cooperation between national authorities responsible for the enforcement of the consumer protection laws

programmeDivision.description: Enforcement and supporting consumers with advice

TopicDetails.description:
Scope:

The grants can support a wide range of activities such as preparing the stakeholders for the new CPC Regulation, staff training, creation of online interfaces and monitoring tools, networking tools including workshops, surveillance, e-enforcement tools and other enforcement capacities, including purchase of equipment for product testing.
TopicDetails.conditions:
1.   Eligible countries: described in section 7.1 of the Call document.

 

2.   Eligibility and admissibility conditions: described in sections 6 and 7 of the Call document.
     

 

Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.

 

3.   Evaluation

      3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: described in sections 8, 9, 10 and 12 of the Call document.
      

      3.2 For submission and evaluation process, see Guide for applicants

 

4.   Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: described in section 4 of the Call document.

 

5.   Proposal templates and model grant agreements (MGA):

       Joint Action (CONS-JA) / Framework Partnership Agreement (FPA):
      Proposal templates are available after entering the submission tool below.
      Multi-beneficiary Model Grant Agreement
      Mono-beneficiary Model Grant Agreement
      
     

6.   Additional requirements:
Please perform a financial viability self-check, using the PP tool of the financial viability self-check.

 

Members of consortium are required to conclude a consortium agreement, in principle prior to the signature of the grant agreement.

7.   Additional documents:
      Annual work programme 2019
     Consumer Programme 2014-2020

      EU Financial Regulation

Attention! 

Please be aware that general documents and models  (model grant agreements, guides for applicants, standard proposal forms, etc.) may be updated. In such case, changes are reflected in the history of changes table in the document. In case of changes which could impact proposal submission (very exceptional), we will inform you via a call update (or other means).
TopicDetails.supportInfo:
Contact CHAFEA Consumer Programme helpdesk for further assistance related to the Programme, the topics, call and the content of proposals at CHAFEA-CP-CALLS@ec.europa.eu.

Funding and Tenders Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals.

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

H2020 Online Manual - Please use the manual with caution and only for the Participant Portal tools guidance, i.e. Submission service and Beneficiary register, because it is H2020 specific and does not cover the Consumer Programme rules. Some aspects of the Consumer Programme are different to the provisions of the H2020 programmes.
TopicDetails.sepTemplate:
To access the Electronic Submission Service, please click on the submission-button next to the type of action that corresponds to your proposal. You will then be asked to confirm your choice of the type of action and topic, as these cannot be changed in the submission system. Upon confirmation, you will be linked to the correct entry point.

To access existing draft proposals for this topic, please login to the Funding & Tenders Portal and select the My Proposals page of the My Area section.

latestInfos.content: The deadline for submission of proposals under the call CONS-CPC-JA-2019 has been extended to 19 September 2019 at 17:00:00 Brussels time.
The submission session is now available for: CONS-CPC-JA-2019(CONS-JA)
The submission session is now available for: CONS-CPC-JA-2019(CONS-JA)
